properties.Name: DunBradstreetGovernmentActivitySummary
properties.Description: Summary indicators of government contracts, grants, debarment, loans and debt or fees. Also indicates if company is eligible for socio-economic programs such as minority, veteran, women-owned, small business, 8A, hub-zone and more.

Columns.Name: DunsNumber
Columns.Description: Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) provides a D-U-N-S Number, a unique nine digit identification number, for each physical location of your business.

Columns.Name: ReportPurchaseDate
Columns.Description: The purchase date of the report.

Columns.Name: GovernmentBorrowerIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the company has funds that are subsidized by the government, which protects lenders against defaults on payments, making it easier for lenders to offer potential borrowers lower interest.

Columns.Name: AdministrativeDebtIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that this company owes (or has owed) a debt to the federal government either as a result of fees levied for government services, fines, or claims, or as a result of overpayment by government agencies for goods or services purchased from the business.

Columns.Name: GranteesIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that this business has received an award of financial assistance in the form of money by the federal government, with no expectation of funds being paid back.

Columns.Name: PartyExcludedFromFederalProgramIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the company is excluded from federal program participation.

Columns.Name: PublicCompanyIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that a business has permission to offer its registered securities (stock, bonds, etc.) for sale to the general public, typically through a stock exchange, or occasionally a company whose stock is traded over-the-counter via market makers who use non-exchange quotation services.

Columns.Name: ContractorIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that this business has received an award of procurement funding by the federal government for specific goods or services.

Columns.Name: ImporterExporterIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that this business imports materials for re-manufacture or sale, exports products to other countries, and/or operates as an agent (keeps no inventory and does not take title to goods).

Columns.Name: LaborSurplusAreaIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that this business is operating in a labor surplus area as defined for a Civil Jurisdiction, rather than the entire Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA), where the average unemployment number is 20% higher than the average U.S. unemployment rate in the last two calendar years. Provided by the Small Business Administration.

Columns.Name: SmallBusinessIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that a business is privately owned and operated, with a small number of employees and relatively low volume of sales. The Small Business Administration establishes small business size standards on an industry-by-industry basis, but generally specifies a small business as having fewer than 500 employees for manufacturing businesses and less than $7 million in annual receipts for most non-manufacturing businesses.

Columns.Name: WomenOwnedIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that a business is at least 51% owned by one or more women; or, in the case of any publicly owned business, 51% or more of the stock of which is owned by one or more women; and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by one or more women.

Columns.Name: MinorityOwnedIndicator
Columns.Description: indicates whether the company is owned by a minority.

Properties.Description: Summary indicators of government contracts, grants, debarment, loans and debt or fees. Also indicates if company is eligible for socio-economic programs such as minority, veteran, women-owned, small business, 8A, hub-zone and more.
